	Proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint).
	Ability to maintain confidentiality and demonstrate discretion.


Remuneration
The&nbsp;remuneration&nbsp;is competitive&nbsp;along with other benefits.

Note


	Further assessments will&nbsp;be required.&nbsp;
	Interviews are on a rolling basis to this date. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Front Desk Officer Job at Myrtle Management Consultants Limited




        
    

        
        Myrtle Management Consultants Limited - Our client is a world class servicing company that provides total Offshore and Onshore solutions across the entire Oil & Gas Industry. Their services cover Engineering, Procurement, Project management, Fabrication / Construction, Installation and Commissioning to project owners and operators.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	Our client is seeking a professional, organized, and proactive Front Desk Officer to join our team and serve as the first point of contact for clients, partners, and visitors.


Key Responsibilities


	Serve as the first point of contact at the reception desk, welcoming visitors and directing them appropriately.
	Manage and route incoming calls, emails, and correspondence to the right departments.
	Maintain a professional front office environment that reflects the company’s brand and values.
	Coordinate meeting room bookings and ensure availability for internal and external stakeholders.
	Support administrative tasks, including filing, record keeping, and documentation.
	Assist with office logistics such as receiving deliveries, handling mail, and liaising with vendors.
	Provide general administrative support to various departments as required.


Qualifications and Skills


	Bachelor’s degree or HND in Business Administration, Secretarial Studies, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in front desk, receptionist, or administrative roles (experience in an EPC or engineering environment is an added advantage).
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills with a professional demeanor.
	Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities.
	Proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint).
	Ability to maintain confidentiality and demonstrate discretion.


Remuneration
The remuneration is competitive along with other benefits.

Note


	Further assessments will be required. 
	Interviews are on a rolling basis to this date. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

  "title": "Inventory Officer / Data Entry Officer",
  "description": "Mopheth Pharmaceutical Nigeria Limited is people and customer focused organization, we thrive to attain excellence and perfection at all times.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Officer / Data Entry Officer
Job Locations:&nbsp;Victoria Island &amp; Lekki -&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
Inventory Management:


	Monitor and maintain inventory levels to ensure stock availability.
	Perform regular physical stock counts and reconcile with system data.
	Identify discrepancies between physical stock and inventory records, investigate, and report variances.
	Ensure proper labeling, storage, and organization of stock items.
	Coordinate stock movement, including receiving, issuing, and transferring inventory.


Data Entry &amp; Record-Keeping:


	Accurately input inventory data into ERP or inventory management systems.
	Maintain up-to-date records of inventory transactions (receipts, issues, returns).
	Generate daily, weekly, and monthly inventory reports.
	Ensure documentation and files (invoices, delivery notes, stock reports) are organized and accessible.


Compliance &amp; Coordination:


	Assist in audits and ensure compliance with inventory policies and procedures.
	Coordinate with procurement, warehouse, and finance departments for inventory-related matters.
	Ensure safe and clean work environment in compliance with company and safety standards.


Qualifications &amp; Skills


	Education: High school diploma or equivalent; Bachelor&#39;s degree preferred in Economics or Statistics.
	Experience:&nbsp;2-6 years of experience in inventory management or data entry role.
	Technical Skills:&nbsp;Proficient in Microsoft Excel and inventory software (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Zoho, or similar)..


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@mophethgroup.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Inventory Officer / Data Entry Officer Job at Mopheth Pharmaceutical Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Mopheth Pharmaceutical Nigeria Limited is people and customer focused organization, we thrive to attain excellence and perfection at all times.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Officer / Data Entry Officer
Job Locations: Victoria Island & Lekki - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
Inventory Management:
     

            
    




	Monitor and maintain inventory levels to ensure stock availability.
	Perform regular physical stock counts and reconcile with system data.
	Identify discrepancies between physical stock and inventory records, investigate, and report variances.
	Ensure proper labeling, storage, and organization of stock items.
	Coordinate stock movement, including receiving, issuing, and transferring inventory.


Data Entry & Record-Keeping:


	Accurately input inventory data into ERP or inventory management systems.
	Maintain up-to-date records of inventory transactions (receipts, issues, returns).
	Generate daily, weekly, and monthly inventory reports.
	Ensure documentation and files (invoices, delivery notes, stock reports) are organized and accessible.


Compliance & Coordination:


	Assist in audits and ensure compliance with inventory policies and procedures.
	Coordinate with procurement, warehouse, and finance departments for inventory-related matters.
	Ensure safe and clean work environment in compliance with company and safety standards.


Qualifications & Skills


	Education: High school diploma or equivalent; Bachelor's degree preferred in Economics or Statistics.
	Experience: 2-6 years of experience in inventory management or data entry role.
	Technical Skills: Proficient in Microsoft Excel and inventory software (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Zoho, or similar)..


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@mophethgroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
